TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UIElement3DAutomationPeer extends System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer

Docs.summary: Exposes types to UI Automation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default, any class that inherits from <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D> uses <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer> to communicate with [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)].
If you create a class that inherits from <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D>, you may want to provide an automation peer to support the functionality of your class. Override the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer.GetClassNameCore%2A> method to return a string that represents the type of the element associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer>. For example, if you create a class called `My3DElement` and an automation peer called `My3DElementAutomationPeer`, override the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer.GetClassNameCore%2A> method to return the string "My3DElement".
If your class matches one of the known control types, override the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer.GetAutomationControlTypeCore%2A> method to return that <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType>. Note that although the existing <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> values are generally associated with 2D controls, the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> indicates a control's functionality, not its appearance. So if your <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D> invokes an action when the user clicks it, you probably want <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer.GetHelpTextCore%2A> to return <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Button?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
The behavior of your custom <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D> determines what other methods you should override. Each method topic in the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer> describes how the method is used and when it is appropriate to override it.
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.UIElement3D owner) cil managed

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer CreatePeerForElement(class System.Windows.UIElement3D element) cil managed
Public Shared Function CreatePeerForElement (element As UIElement3D) As AutomationPeer

Docs.param: The that is associated with this .
Docs.summary: Creates a for the specified .
Docs.returns: A for the specified .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer> remains in memory until the associated <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D> is destroyed.
The same instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer> is returned from subsequent calls to this method and to calls to <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer.FromElement%2A>. The type of the peer is determined by the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D.OnCreateAutomationPeer%2A> virtual callback. If <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D> does not implement the callback, no <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer> is created and this method returns `null`.
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method calls the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetAcceleratorKey%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to get the value. <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetAcceleratorKey%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> returns a value only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AcceleratorKey%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property is set. You can override <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer.GetAcceleratorKeyCore%2A> and add logic to provide the accelerator key in a way that makes sense for your <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D>.
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

<xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

remarks.format:
## Remarks Typically, the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer.GetHelpTextCore%2A> method returns a string that is the same text that the control provides in the tooltip. This method calls the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetHelpText%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to get the value. <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetHelpText%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> returns a value only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.HelpText%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property is set. You can override <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer.GetHelpTextCore%2A> and add logic to provide the help text in a way that makes sense for your <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D>.
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

remarks.format:
## Remarks Return a string that indicates whether the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D> is conveying status about an item. For example, an item associated with a contact in a messaging application might be "Busy" or "Connected".
This method calls the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetItemStatus%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to get the value. <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetItemStatus%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> returns a value only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.ItemStatus%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property is set. You can override <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer.GetItemStatusCore%2A> and add logic to provide the item status in a way that makes sense for your <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D>.
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

Docs.summary: Returns the string that represents the that is associated with this . This method is called by .
Docs.returns: The string that represents the that is associated with this .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can think of the name property as what users use to explain the control they are referring to. Be sure to have a textual representation for all controls in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gui](~/includes/tlasharptla-gui-md.md)] so that you can programmatically refer to the control in a localized manner.
This method calls the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetName%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to get the value. <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetName%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> returns a value only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.Name%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property is set. You can override <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer.GetNameCore%2A> and add logic to provide a name in a way that makes sense for your <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D>.
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool IsContentElementCore() cil managed
Protected Overrides Function IsContentElementCore () As Boolean

Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the that is associated with this is an element that contains data that is presented to the user. This method is called by .
Docs.returns: in all cases.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Override the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer.IsContentElementCore%2A> method if your <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D> is not a content element. A content element contains data that is presented to the user. An example of a content element is an item in a list box or a button on a dialog box. You typically use non-content elements, which are also called peripheral elements, to manipulate the content in a composite control. An example of a non-content element is the button on a drop-down control.
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

Docs.returns: in all cases.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Do not override this method.
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool IsOffscreenCore() cil managed
Protected Overrides Function IsOffscreenCore () As Boolean

Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the that is associated with this is off the screen. This method is called by .
Docs.returns: if the element is not on the screen; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property does not indicate whether the element is visible. In some circumstances, an element is on the screen but is still not visible. For example, if the element is on the screen but obscured by other elements, it might not be visible. In this case the method returns `false`.
Classes that inherit from <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer> typically do not need to override <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer.IsOffscreenCore%2A>.
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

Protected Overrides Function IsPasswordCore () As Boolean

Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the that is associated with this contains protected content. This method is called by .
Docs.returns: in all cases.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Override <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer.IsKeyboardFocusableCore%2A> if your <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D> contains protected content, such as a password.
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the that is associated with this is required to be completed on a form. This method is called by .
Docs.returns: if the is required to be completed on a form; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method calls the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetIsRequiredForForm%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to get the value. <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetIsRequiredForForm%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> returns a value only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.IsRequiredForForm%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property is set. You can override <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer.IsRequiredForFormCore%2A> and add logic to provide a value that makes sense for your <xref:System.Windows.UIElement3D>.
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

remarks.format:
## Remarks Classes that inherit from <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer> typically do not need to override <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer.SetFocusCore%2A>.
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElement3DAutomationPeer> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
